subject: When "extends TestCase" added, annotations don't work
msgSnippet: Hey guys, I have a strange error... I m running Junit4 tests via Eclipse runner. Everything works perfectly; all the annotation do what they re supposed to,
messageBody:
Hey guys,

I have a strange error... I'm running Junit4 tests via Eclipse runner.
Everything works perfectly; all the annotation do what they're
supposed to, the test runs great, etc. I've needed to make sure of
"assertEquals", however, so I "extends TestCase". After making this
change NONE of the asserts work anymore. Nothing is setup, no tests
are detected, etc. Below is my code:

public class FeedDaoTest extends TestCase {

private FeedDao feedDao;

@BeforeClass
public static void runBeforeClass() throws Exception {
// Create initial context
System.setProperty(Context.INITIAL_CONTEXT_FACTORY,
"org.apache.naming.java.javaURLContextFactory");
System.setProperty(Context.URL_PKG_PREFIXES, "org.apache.naming");
InitialContext ic = new InitialContext();

ic.createSubcontext("java:");
ic.createSubcontext("java:comp");
ic.createSubcontext("java:comp/env");
ic.createSubcontext("java:comp/env/jdbc");

// Construct DataSource
OracleConnectionPoolDataSource ds = new OracleConnectionPoolDataSource();
ds.setURL("XXXX");
ds.setUser("XXXX");
ds.setPassword("XXXXX");

ic.bind("java:comp/env/jdbc/XXX", ds);
}

@Before
public void runBeforeEveryTest() throws Exception {
feedDao = new FeedDaoJdbc();
}

@After
public void runAfterEveryTest() {
feedDao = null;
}

@Test
public void getActiveFeedTypes() throws Exception {

List<String> expected = generateExpectedActiveFeedTypes();
List<String> actual = feedDao.getActiveFeedTypes();

assertEquals(expected, actual);
}
}
